content.raw:
I'm using ubuntu 18.04 and gazebo 9 
I recently found an issue that the size of the file default.log in ./gazebo/server-11345 grows too fast right after i run gazebo. (almost 100MB/s I guess..?)

In the file, the following messages are repeatedly written.

1555486397 770190666) [Msg] Waiting for master.
(1555486397 783754311) [Msg] Connected to gazebo master @ http://127.0.0.1:11345
(1555486397 783791832) [Msg] Publicized address: 192.168.1.227
(1555486398 12634102) Init world[default]
(1555486398 14095658) Sleep time is larger than clock resolution, skipping sleep
(1555486398 14105286) Sleep time is larger than clock resolution, skipping sleep
(1555486398 14112504) Sleep time is larger than clock resolution, skipping sleep
(1555486398 14121265) Sleep time is larger than clock resolution, skipping sleep
(1555486398 14129763) Sleep time is larger than clock resolution, skipping sleep
(1555486398 14136093) Sleep time is larger than clock resolution, skipping sleep
(1555486398 14146442) Sleep time is larger than clock resolution, skipping sleep
(1555486398 14151976) Sleep time is larger than clock resolution, skipping sleep
(1555486398 14159934) Sleep time is larger than clock resolution, skipping sleep
(1555486398 14167915) Sleep time is larger than clock resolution, skipping sleep
(1555486398 14175878) Sleep time is larger than clock resolution, skipping sleep
(1555486398 14183792) Sleep time is larger than clock resolution, skipping sleep
(1555486398 14191676) Sleep time is larger than clock resolution, skipping sleep
(1555486398 14201169) Sleep time is larger than clock resolution, skipping sleep
(1555486398 14209218) Sleep time is larger than clock resolution, skipping sleep
(1555486398 14215573) Sleep time is larger than clock resolution, skipping sleep
(1555486398 14225780) Sleep time is larger than clock resolution, skipping sleep
(1555486398 14233197) Sleep time is larger than clock resolution, skipping sleep
..........

I found that there was similar issue before (#!/osrf/gazebo/issues/983/gazebo-log-grows-too-fast).
Please fix this!!!
content.html:
I'm using ubuntu 18.04 and gazebo 9 I recently found an issue that the size of the file default.log in ./gazebo/server-11345 grows too fast right after i run gazebo. (almost 100MB/s I guess..?)

In the file, the following messages are repeatedly written.

1555486397 770190666) [Msg] Waiting for master. (1555486397 783754311) [Msg] Connected to gazebo master @ http://127.0.0.1:11345 (1555486397 783791832) [Msg] Publicized address: 192.168.1.227 (1555486398 12634102) Init world[default] (1555486398 14095658) Sleep time is larger than clock resolution, skipping sleep (1555486398 14105286) Sleep time is larger than clock resolution, skipping sleep (1555486398 14112504) Sleep time is larger than clock resolution, skipping sleep (1555486398 14121265) Sleep time is larger than clock resolution, skipping sleep (1555486398 14129763) Sleep time is larger than clock resolution, skipping sleep (1555486398 14136093) Sleep time is larger than clock resolution, skipping sleep (1555486398 14146442) Sleep time is larger than clock resolution, skipping sleep (1555486398 14151976) Sleep time is larger than clock resolution, skipping sleep (1555486398 14159934) Sleep time is larger than clock resolution, skipping sleep (1555486398 14167915) Sleep time is larger than clock resolution, skipping sleep (1555486398 14175878) Sleep time is larger than clock resolution, skipping sleep (1555486398 14183792) Sleep time is larger than clock resolution, skipping sleep (1555486398 14191676) Sleep time is larger than clock resolution, skipping sleep (1555486398 14201169) Sleep time is larger than clock resolution, skipping sleep (1555486398 14209218) Sleep time is larger than clock resolution, skipping sleep (1555486398 14215573) Sleep time is larger than clock resolution, skipping sleep (1555486398 14225780) Sleep time is larger than clock resolution, skipping sleep (1555486398 14233197) Sleep time is larger than clock resolution, skipping sleep ..........

I found that there was similar issue before (#!/osrf/gazebo/issues/983/gazebo-log-grows-too-fast). Please fix this!!!
